speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, today I recognize Kimberly Heinemann, an intern in my Washington, DC office, for all of the hard work she has done for me, my staff, and the State of South Dakota over the past several months.

Kimberly is a graduate of Flandreau High School in Flandreau and Augustana College in Sioux Falls where she received a bachelor of arts in biology with a minor in chemistry. This fall she will begin studying at the University of Nebraska Medical Center College of Dentistry. She is a hard worker who has been dedicated to getting the most out of her internship experience.
I would like to extend my sincere thanks and appreciation to Kimberly for all of the fine work she has done and wish her continued success in the years to come.
